description: Creates a relay resource which can be used in rules to relay incoming emails to defined relay destinations.

parameters.name: Authentication
parameters.description: Authentication for the relay destination server--specify the secretARN where the SMTP credentials are stored. NoAuthentication (dict) --- Keep an empty structure if the relay destination server does not require SMTP credential authentication. SecretArn (string) --- The ARN of the secret created in secrets manager where the relay server's SMTP credentials are stored.

nested_params.name: NoAuthentication
nested_params.description: Keep an empty structure if the relay destination server does not require SMTP credential authentication.

nested_params.name: SecretArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the secret created in secrets manager where the relay server's SMTP credentials are stored.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique token that Amazon SES uses to recognize subsequent retries of the same request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: RelayName
parameters.description: The unique name of the relay resource.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags used to organize, track, or control access for the resource. For example, { 'tags': {'key1':'value1', 'key2':'value2'} }. (dict) --- A key-value pair (the value is optional), that you can define and assign to Amazon Web Services resources. The key of the key-value tag. The value of the key-value tag.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the key-value tag.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the key-value tag.

nested_items.name: RelayId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier of the created relay resource.
